name: 'Impact Winter' Online Trivia | 'West Wing' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.text: At the beginning of the episode, what song was Josh and Donna singing while having breakfast in his office?
questions.explanation:
Monday, Monday.

	Donna was singing backup for Josh while they ate breakfast. Donna was trying to talk to Josh about something, but they kept getting interrupted so she scheduled them to have a lunch meeting. While they were in his office, CJ called and told them that the President had an MS episode on the plane.

questions.text: During the meeting with the Chinese, what was the signal to let CJ know that the President needed a break?
questions.explanation:
Tug of the earlobe.

	CJ wasn't in the room when the President started making the signal so Toby had to go out and get CJ so she could make an excuse to get the President out of the room.

questions.text: What was the name of the program manager for NASA that came to see Josh?
questions.explanation:
Walter Strout.

	Walter Strout came to tell Josh that an asteroid was going to hit the Earth in forty-six hours.

questions.text: Who did Bartlet say this to, "I'm just saying, you drop me, that's a moment that follows you the rest of your life"?
questions.explanation:
Curtis.

	While they were arguing over how the President was going to get off the plane, the President asked Curtis to pick him up and take him off the plane. President Bartlet said the above quote as Curtis was carrying him toward the door.

questions.text: Who did the President want to hit because they kept reminding him to thank President Lian?
questions.explanation:
Kate.

	When the Chinese delegation arrived, the President remembered to thank President Lian for letting them into the beautiful hall where they had the meeting.

questions.text: The original plan was for them to stay in China for six days, but because of the President's MS episode, CJ changed the schedule from six days to what?
questions.explanation:
3 days.

	The President didn't like it, but he agreed. In the three days the President was in China, he wanted everything discussed and nothing left out.

questions.text: "Don't quote me to me." To whom did President Bartlet make this remark?
questions.explanation:
CJ.

	CJ was reminding the President of something he said to her a few month earlier and the President realized what she was doing and made this comment.

questions.text: Who made the announcement that the President had an MS episode while on the plane to China?
questions.explanation:
Vice President Russell.

	The Vice President insisted on making the statement so it looked like someone of authority was in charge. The Vice President started out by saying he was playing tennis when he heard the news and that he couldn't believe his ears. Josh told Donna that it made the Vice President sound vigorous.

questions.text: Did the asteroid hit the United States?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The note came to Josh and Charlie made the announcement that the asteroid had missed them.

questions.text: When Leo suggested that Josh go find his candidate, where did Josh go?
questions.explanation:
Santos.

	Josh went to Houston to see Matt Santos. Matt thought Josh was lost when he showed up on his doorstep, but Josh told him he wanted him to run and Matt said he didn't want to run for Congress again. Josh didn't say anything else.
